snippet: The chief federal public defender in Manhattan asked that his office be appointed to represent the suspect, Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, who had been captured in Libya.
abstract: David E Patton, chief federal public defender, asks that his office be appointed to represent terror suspect Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, who was captured in Libya and is said to be undergoing interrogation on a Navy ship in the Mediterranean Sea; Ruqai’s capture is seen as intelligence coup for the United States, given that his relationship with Al Qaeda dates to its early days in 1990s; he is also believed to have information about the group as it exists today.
lead_paragraph: The chief federal public defender in Manhattan asked that his office be appointed to represent the suspect, Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, who had been captured in Libya.

headline.main: Lawyer Sought for Terror Suspect Held on Navy Ship
headline.print_headline: Effort to Give Suspect Held On Navy Ship A Lawyer
